intro: Crotalaria jinpingensis, commonly known as the Jinping crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it has garnered interest in botanical research.
